AudioFormat.description: Loosely describe audio format. Some values (e.g., 'wav') denote containers; others (e.g., 'linear16') specify encoding only; cannot describe containers that can contain different audio encodings.

TextPart.description: A part of the message that contains text.

id.description: The ID of the part, if applicable.

ImagePart.description: A part of the message that contains an image.

mime_type.description: The MIME type of the image. E.g. "image/jpeg", "image/png".

width.description: The width of the image in pixels.

height.description: The height of the image in pixels.

id.description: The ID of the part, if applicable.

AudioPart.description: A part of the message that contains an audio.

sample_rate.description: The sample rate of the audio. E.g. 44100, 48000.

channels.description: The number of channels of the audio. E.g. 1, 2.

id.description: The ID of the part, if applicable.

ToolCallPart.description: A part of the message that represents a call to a tool the model wants to use.

tool_call_id.description: The ID of the tool call, used to match the tool result with the tool call.

tool_name.description: The name of the tool to call.

args.description: The arguments to pass to the tool.

id.description: The ID of the part, if applicable. This might not be the same as the tool_call_id.

ToolResultPart.description: A part of the message that represents the result of a tool call.

tool_call_id.description: The ID of the tool call from previous assistant message.

tool_name.description: The name of the tool that was called.

content.description: The content of the tool result.

is_error.description: Marks the tool result as an error.

TextPartDelta.description: A delta update for a text part, used in streaming or incremental updates of a message.

id.description: The ID of the part, if applicable.

ToolCallPartDelta.description: A delta update for a tool call part, used in streaming of a tool invocation.

tool_call_id.description: The ID of the tool call, used to match the tool result with the tool call.

tool_name.description: The name of the tool to call.

args.description: The partial JSON string of the arguments to pass to the tool.

id.description: The ID of the part, if applicable. This might not be the same as the tool_call_id.

AudioPartDelta.description: A delta update for an audio part, used in streaming of an audio message.

sample_rate.description: The sample rate of the audio. E.g. 44100, 48000.

channels.description: The number of channels of the audio. E.g. 1, 2.

id.description: The ID of the part, if applicable.

PartDelta.description: Delta parts used in partial updates.

ContentDelta.description: Represents a delta update in a message's content, enabling partial streaming updates in LLM responses.

UserMessage.description: Represents a message sent by the user.

AssistantMessage.description: Represents a message generated by the model.

ToolMessage.description: Represents tool result in the message history. Only ToolResultPart should be included in the content.

Message.description: A message in an LLM conversation history.

Modality.description: Defines the modality of content (e.g., text or audio) in LLM responses.

Tool.description: Represents a tool that can be used by the model.

parameters.description: The JSON schema of the parameters that the tool accepts. The type must be "object".

ToolChoiceAuto.description: The model will automatically choose the tool to use or not use any tools.

ToolChoiceNone.description: The model will not use any tools.

ToolChoiceRequired.description: The model will be forced to use a tool.

ToolChoiceTool.description: The model will use the specified tool.

ToolChoiceOption.description: Determines how the model should choose which tool to use. "auto" - The model will automatically choose the tool to use or not use any tools. "none" - The model will not use any tools. "required" - The model will be forced to use a tool. { type: "tool", toolName: "toolName" } - The model will use the specified tool.

ResponseFormatText.description: Specifies that the model response should be in plain text format.

ResponseFormatJson.description: Specifies that the model response should be in JSON format adhering to a specified schema.

ResponseFormatOption.description: The format that the model must output.

LanguageModelCapability.description: A metadata property that describes the capability of the model.

ModelTokensDetails.description: Represents the token usage of the model.

ModelUsage.description: Represents the token usage of the model.

ModelResponse.description: Represents the response generated by the model.

PartialModelResponse.description: Represents a partial response from the language model, useful for streaming output via async generator.

LanguageModelInput.description: Defines the input parameters for the language model completion.

system_prompt.description: A system prompt is a way of providing context and instructions to the model

messages.description: A list of messages comprising the conversation so far.

tools.description: Definitions of tools that the model may use.

max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens that can be generated in the chat completion.

temperature.description: Amount of randomness injected into the response. Ranges from 0.0 to 1.0

top_p.description: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. Ranges from 0.0 to 1.0

top_k.description: Only sample from the top K options for each subsequent token. Used to remove 'long tail' low probability responses. Ranges from 0.0 to 1.0

presence_penalty.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

frequency_penalty.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

seed.description: The seed (integer), if set and supported by the model, to enable deterministic results.

modalities.description: The modalities that the model should support.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that store additional information about the request. This is forwarded to the model provider if supported.

extra.description: Extra options that the model may support.

LanguageModelPricing.description: A metadata property that describes the pricing of the model.

input_cost_per_text_token.description: The cost in USD per single text token for input.

input_cost_per_cached_text_token.description: The cost in USD per single cached text token for input.

output_cost_per_text_token.description: The cost in USD per single text token for output.

input_cost_per_audio_token.description: The cost in USD per single audio token for input.

input_cost_per_cached_audio_token.description: The cost in USD per single cached audio token for input.

output_cost_per_audio_token.description: The cost in USD per single audio token for output.

input_cost_per_image_token.description: The cost in USD per single image token for input.

input_cost_per_cached_image_token.description: The cost in USD per single cached image token for input.

output_cost_per_image_token.description: The cost in USD per single image token for output.
